recipe.title: Fluffy Pancakes
recipe.description: Light and fluffy American-style breakfast pancakes

ingredients.name: Maple syrup and berries to serve

steps.descr: Mix flour, baking powder, and sugar in a bowl
steps.instructions: Mix flour, baking powder, and sugar in a bowl

on_enter.say: Right, let's start by mixing the flour, baking powder, and sugar in a bowl. Give it a good stir until everything's nicely combined.
Now, let's whisk the egg and milk together until they're beautifully blended. You want a nice, smooth mixture.

steps.descr: Combine wet and dry ingredients until just mixed
steps.instructions: Combine wet and dry ingredients until just mixed

on_enter.say: Brilliant! Now let's combine the wet and dry ingredients. Just mix until they're combined - a few lumps are fine, they'll make the pancakes fluffier.

steps.descr: Heat butter in a pan over medium heat
steps.instructions: Heat butter in a pan over medium heat

on_enter.say: Let's get the pan ready by heating some butter over medium heat. You'll know it's ready when the butter starts to sizzle gently.

steps.descr: Pour small ladles of batter into pan
steps.instructions: Pour small ladles of batter into pan

on_enter.say: Time to pour small ladles of batter into the pan. Make sure to leave a bit of space between each one so they can spread out nicely.

steps.descr: Cook until bubbles appear, flip and cook other side
steps.instructions: Cook until bubbles appear, flip and cook other side

on_enter.say: Cook the pancakes until bubbles start to appear on the surface, then give them a flip and cook the other side until it's golden brown. You should smell that delicious aroma!

steps.descr: Serve stacked with syrup and fresh berries
steps.instructions: Serve stacked with syrup and fresh berries

on_enter.say: Fantastic! Let's stack those pancakes high, drizzle with maple syrup, and top with fresh berries. Time to dig in and enjoy!

notes.text:
Don't overmix - lumpy batter makes fluffier pancakes
Keep cooked pancakes warm in a low oven
Add blueberries to the batter for extra flavor
